      • currentSize

        public int currentSize()

      • sort

        public void sort(boolean byKey,
        boolean asc,
        int min,
        int max)
        Sorts and filters wordlist.
        Parameters:
        byKey - Attribute to sort, true = byKey, false = byValue.
        asc - Sortdirection true = asc, false = desc.
        min - Filter for min occurence of the word in the list.
        max - Filter for max occurence of the word in the list.

      • sort

        public void sort(boolean byKey,
        boolean asc)
        Sorts and wordlist by key (words) or by value (word count) ascending or descending.
        Parameters:
        byKey - Defines sortfield. true = key, false = value.
        asc - Defines the direction, true = asc, false = desc.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns actual wordlist as a concatinated string. Format: "word1 1\nword2 10\n"
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        actual wordlist concatinated to one String.

        Sorts a Map by its keys and gives back the sorted keys as a LinkedList.
        Parameters:

        asc - Direction to be sorted. true = asc, flase = desc.

      • sortByValues

        private java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> sortByValues(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> words,
                                                  boolean asc)
        Sorts a Map by its value and gives back the sorted keys as a LinkedList. Overrides method compare in the ananoumous class Comperator used to define the sort direction.
        Parameters:
        words - The Map to be sorted.
        asc - Direction to be sorted. true = asc, flase = desc.
        Returns:
        Sorted LinkedList containing the keys (words).

      • countWords

        private void countWords(java.io.FileReader reader)
        Filters the words out of a FileReader and counts the occurence of the individual word. A word is at least two chars long and contains no special characters like (-,.«»§). Words are threated case-sensitive.
        Parameters:
        reader - FileReader containing the textfile.
